articles.title: James Webb telescope set for launch in search for life in the far-off universe - RFI English
articles.description: The €10billion James Webb space telescope - the largest and most powerful space observatory ever built - is finally set to launch from Europe's spaceport in French Guiana on 22 December.

articles.author: Andrew Jones
articles.title: Europe's Mars orbiter relays data from Chinese rover back to Earth - Space.com
articles.description: The European Space Agency's Mars Express collected data from China's Zhurong Mars rover and successfully sent it to Earth following a series of experimental communications tests.
articles.content:
The European Space Agency's Mars Express collected data from China's Zhurong Mars rover and successfully sent it to Earth following a series of experimental communications tests.

articles.title: French cheese product imported by Cold Storage recalled due to 'possible' presence of bacteria - channelnewsasia.com
articles.description:
SINGAPORE: A cheese product imported from France has been recalled due to the "possible presence" of listeria monocytogenes, a bacteria that can cause foodborne illness. 

The recall for Cantorel’s Plateau 5 Fromages was first issued by a European Commissio…

articles.title: Bird flu is raging, adding to the risks for food inflation - The Straits Times
articles.description: More than 40 countries across Europe, Asia and Africa have seen outbreaks since May, according to World Organisation for Animal Health data.. Read more at straitstimes.com.
